title: EBT suggestion

title: A Fabulous App to help with food waste
text: I read about this app in a NY Times article about food waste. It‚Äôs heartbreaking to see how much food is wasted in America. This app helps connect customers with food that may normally be tossed. Food banks and pantries cannot use out of date foods. And properly stored foods are still excellent past code. I love this opportunity to get phenomenal deals and find stores and restaurants I may not have tried!

title: Not bad.
text:
I think the app concept is great, but having used it in Europe and the US, fair warning the options are much more limited in the US‚Äîespecially if you‚Äôre not in NYC. it‚Äôs also slightly frustrating that you can‚Äôt see what at the very least a general idea of what you‚Äôre getting‚Äîmore detailed reviews from other people, examples from other people etc. 

The customer service aspect also leaves a bit to be desired. They‚Äôre prompt which is nice, just probably not the most helpful or accommodating.

Overall, not bad and you‚Äôre saving food waste which is always great, it‚Äôs just frustrating how limited the options are, and when you have a slight issue or the app is unclear that customer service isn‚Äôt particularly willing to accommodate.

title: Love it-spread the word save the planet!
text:
Well, I saw app on tv so I downloaded it and tried it. Gosh, a bakery near me that I already loved, got two surprise bags and was really happy with what was inside. It was fun the surprise grab bag idea.

Now I wish someone would spread the word to other food places in Los Angeles because it is not only a disgrace and shame that most places have to throw their food out and dosed with bleach so homeless do not take from trash. So glad someone designed this app!
Years ago, we found out that food places have no choice because of the laws and ordinances.

title: Good to Go
text:
Such a great idea. For families with limited budgets and mouths to feed. While it‚Äôs pot luck and that‚Äôs part of the fun,  it has helped provide food and treats that we couldn‚Äôt otherwise afford. So yeah Spend the 4-15 dollars and see what you get. Most things are 4-5 dollars. (I still have that big pot of spaghetti, soup or stew on standby anyway.) It‚Äôs worth the gamble.   We ATE 
What I got for 15 dollars:
4 slices of pizza 
14 large Mexican pastries (not stale)
1 large salad
1 large turkey/ cheese/L&T Sandwich 
                                Thank you Good to Go

title: Dumpster diving but more expensive
text: I picked up a bag of produce from Manalo market in San Diego and everything was rotten. The avocado, the pear, the citrus, the lettuce, even the pineapple when you cut it open was moldy soft, rotten. Maybe if you stick with donuts and cookies from other venders  it‚Äôs OK? If this review allowed you to send pictures I could post images. I got a hot meal as well. Basically it was a day old chicken which theoretically could be cut up and used in chicken salad so I can‚Äôt complain about that and then I got a really disgusting small tub of some kind of pork rinds and maybe that‚Äôs an acquired taste so I‚Äôm just putting it out there that it wasn‚Äôt edible. At least for me. I could go to McDonald‚Äôs for $6 and get a better deal and that‚Äôs not saying much ):
